title: Remove selected Settings UI elements

requirements.text:
Remove the selected Settings UI elements identified by the provided XPaths (apply changes ONLY to these elements):
1) Remove the element at /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1] (Settings card header/title area).
2) Remove the element at /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[1]/input[1] (the first Settings input).
3) Remove the element at /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[1]/label[1] (the first Settings label).
4) Remove the element at /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[2]/label[1] (the second Settings label).

User-facing text should remain in English.

quotes:
Remove
The user has selected the following 4 elements from the page for context.
For each element, there is an XPath expression leading to the selected element. Use the XPath expressions to identify the elements to edit.
The user instructions should be applied ONLY to the elements selected in this prompt.

acceptanceCriteria: The element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[1]/div[1] is no longer rendered.
The element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[1]/input[1] is no longer rendered.
The element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[1]/label[1] is no longer rendered.
The element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[3]/div[2]/div[2]/label[1] is no longer rendered.
No other UI elements outside the four selected XPaths are changed.

constraints: Apply the removal instructions ONLY to the four selected elements referenced by the provided XPaths.
Do not change the app name (including its word order) outside of what is strictly necessary to remove the selected elements.
nonGoals: Redesigning the Settings card beyond removing the selected elements.
Changing backend behavior or persistence related to app name or helpline settings.
